intro: Ouratea talbotii, commonly known as the talbot's ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded forest environments. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
